vnPQsOcckcP1G4P6jfbUeg.text: Hands down, the best burger(s) I have ever had! If I could only eat one thing for the rest of my life, it would be a GBK cheeseburger with fries. Yes, they are delicious! The meat is fantastic, always fresh and cooked to perfection. They use a relish which is quite lovely. Take note that their burgers are pretty huge so think twice about ordering a side of fries with it. However, I will say that I am tiny yet I devour their burgers (plus the fries) in minutes!! I cannot get enough of this place, seriously. GBK I love you!

NNl0ZAiLzZKDeJCm05VDEQ.text: The vegetarian burgers are different and very tasty! They have quite a good selection of other burgers but as I have never tried any of them I cannot comment on them. The chips are not bad either. You have to find a table and then go up to the counter to order which is a bit of pain.

vASzLgiI2zkvrLUj4b2c_w.text: Absolutely nothing special. You'd expect to be blown away by both the presentation and taste, but instead you're left with nothing more than a full stomach. The selection of burgers isn't bad, but the two or three times I've been (not by choice), it's been incredibly bland. Service is almost non-existant as well and it's certainly not cheap. Alas, I've yet to find a decent burger bar which I'd happily go back to.

7_J8P_xeFnk2ZyOfMDa5jw.text: The name says it all- gourmet burgers are what they do and they do it well. Price is good, quality and selection is great. I recommend trying Macs Gold beer as it comes from the other side of the world in NZ and is naturally brewed and tastes so good

H87IrK1-0U3XScdg5REmKA.text: i've just spent 3 years in new york, where the search for the perfect burger joint is a never-ending quest, and only a few managed to reach the level of the GBK.a kiwi, in london, is flattening the americans on their turf... it's like finding the perfect russian-managed fish & chips in switzerland: astonishing!although it's fair to say new-zealanders DO know a bit or two about good meat, i suppose.anyway, go there, don't let the size of those burgers scare you, and stuff your face... just don't be surprised if you don't eat anything for the next two days!

V6xL0nEE8QynOoffRZSJ_A.text: Didn't work for me. It was just ok. Nothing special. Would stick to the norm cheeseburgers or hamburgers. A bit pricey for a burger. Would be happier to buy 2 cheeseburgers from McDs or Burger King any time.

YsPvqz3zUysIfmxm0SIc7w.text: I had Gourmet Burger about a year ago at the branch near St. Paul's and remember being extremely unimpressed, but I can wholeheartedly recommend this location.The burgers are huge, thickness is just right, juicy, toppings are fresh. Fries are thick cut, but crunchy on the outside, soft and flavorful on the inside. The people were also very nice.Hmm... After writing this, I'm seriously tempted to go back and have it two days in a row!

4JRu_qCUxzvS7s0jrOarvA.text: Huge burgersBeef burgersChicken 'burgers'Lamb burgers (my favorite)Veggie burgersPortobello burgers (I know, technically veggie, but you know what I mean)All of them with rich flavour and paired with thick cut chips and a pint of lager...ahhhh, lovely!

sUA4ipFtegT2KJcqGvC9RQ.text: Great fish and chips. Try the "mushy peas" with your meal. Very friendly wait staff.

0iJEMNuplD31nOogeuSEEg.text: I have not tried every burger in London, but Gourmet Burger Kitchen is the best burger I've ever eaten in London, by far.  This is the way a  hamburger is supposed to taste, not the highly processed junk fast-food that McDonalds and Burger King sells.Gourmet Burger Kitchen uses fresh, gourmet ingredients that are of high quality.  Their milk shakes are thick and delicious, made with real ice cream.  They offer vegetarian ranges, as well as buffalo, chicken, Moroccan Lamb and Wild Boar.  There is very little service here, as I suspect they expect you to place your order and then take care of yourself after that.  This is fine by me.  When the food is this good, I don't need anyone waiting on me.  I'm busy eating my delicious cheeseburger.The gourmet condiments they offer, called dipping sauces, are of excellent quality and flavour!  Their garlic mayo is like mana.****Offer of choice of hamburger & drink for 6.95 until July 26****Print voucher here gbkinfo.com/downloads/GB…Seriously, that offer includes your choice of one of 26 hamburgers as well as one of their milkshakes, wine, beer, juice, or Coke.  That is a bargain for a hamburger and milkshake this good.  They even serve cider, Red Bull, and smoothies.If you like an off-the-backyard-grill gourmet American hamburger, Gourmet Burger Kitchen is your place to go in London.  Be sure to check their website for all the delicious variations they offer and for the background information on the company philosophy and how they acquire their ingredients.TIP:  I'm partial to the cheeseburger as well as the avocado bacon burger with garlic mayo.  I am also a fan of the Oreo milkshake.Seriously delicious burgers, made from quality ingredients, for a fair price~Don't forget to print your voucher to get the 6.95 July offer!

rnuMAl3p9SMJqPaqsYRjKg.text: This a nice little place. All they do is burgers and theyre great at it. I are there in december of last year and had the lamb burger. It was amazing, juicy and held together pretty well considering its lamb. Their chips are amazing, really genuine home made style chips. I would eat there again.

66eJ0YxXZKqr2BJ3ICyYSQ.text: Don't be put off by this restaurants chain-like status. Servingwholesome meaty burgers, delicious hot fries and soothing creamymilkshakes, I think this is one of the best burger restaurants around.On one of my first visits, I had excellent service ( if not alittle slow - but due to the amount of people in the restaurant at thetime, I think this was acceptable), the menus were well arranged, soI could choose what I wanted quickly and without fuss, and our mealcame with only a short wait. I ordered a banana milkshake as well,which came freshly made and tasted delicious. To eat, I had the baconand avocado burger, which was a welcome change to the greasymass-produced burgers in other chains, the meat was pleasingly juicy,and the burger overall was thickly made.  My fries were surprisinglygorgeous and piping hot.

zrybKLTf8M2Qe9ATg_-iIA.text: Certainly not the best GBK I've been too -not only are the staff unfriendly and impatient but there is literally zero ambience too.  This is such a shame because it's a great chain and the Westbourne Grove one really lets the team down.  The food is of course not different from any of the chains I've been too, but I think when you visit a chain where the food is very value for money, the service and ambience should really make up for it.  It's never really busy, which may indicate that many other people feel the same as I do too.

xH_ldSFCa1enX62c2UtX2A.text: A novel approach to burgers.Certainly worth a vist with some wonderful burger combination/varieties. Prompt service. And you must try the Homeslaw!

RY-Kc5OwV9e_Wd8obHRb3w.text: A group of us had an Xmas party where we went bowling in Whiteleys. We heard that the food wasn't particularly good in there, so headed down Westbourne Grove. All of the restaurants along the way were fully booked (it was a Friday night), the rain coupled with me and my female friend complaining that our feet were hurting in our heels; the boys suggested GBK. On entry, the interior was modern and clean. We had a large table at the back, perfect for a group of people. The waiter was helpful, the menu had quite a selection of different burgers. We didn't have to wait long until we tucked in. I have to admit, I was particularly unadventurous and choose a junior beef burger (not just for kids!), as the main burgers looked too large for me. Everyone seemed to enjoy the place and food, and although slightly more expensive than your average highstreet burger joint, definitely worth a try. Menu: gbkinfo.com/downloads/GB…

MYohddXC0tIDEd6ob8utIg.text: GBK has a good range of Classics Beef Burguers right up to Satay, Thai Beef and even the Kiwiburger with a topping of egg and pineapple all made from Aberdeen-Angus Scotch beef. Burgers are served in a fresh sour dough sesame seed bun withmayonnaise all meals are freshly grilled not fryed and you can even get extras on any burger if you ask. The price range suits all pockets that start at £5.50 -£10.00 Sides include bread, s salad olives and lovely chunky cut chips.

photos.caption: Photo of Gourmet Burger Kitchen - London, United Kingdom

qzTSD1-4GLzJ6RXuNDL1nQ.text: A burger joing with a differenceThey offer chorizo or buffalo burgers as well as a number of variety of traditional beef and chicken burgers. The burgers are American style i.e very big, but it is quite expensive well not for C London prices. A burger and chips will set you back £10. However, it is possible to get a 2 for the price of 1 voucher from their website on the internet. If you google it, you should find it easily enough, and this voucher makes it a very good deal and with it I would recommend it to everyone.A burger at home is very time consuming to make. there is the prep, the cooking, cleaning, etc. Go to GBK and sit back and relax!!!

ewYOFN9EVzWe8H5FvkK04A.text: Wandering through Portobello on New Year's Day, I suddenly became ravenous. You know how it is, mid afternoon, the hangover's wearing off, and the stomach's demanding food. Bad food. By which I mean tasty food. And then I saw it, glinting in the distance like a siren. GBK. It's more than an invitation. I went in and ordered a vanilla shake (served in a huge steel mixing cylinder), and a regular burger (all for under ten pounds). Nothing added. I did this because every now and again you have to taste the beef. And the beef was amazing. I like the way you can specify how you want it cooked, which means they use proper cuts of beef to make their burgers. And oh my, as my first meal of 2009, it didn't disappoint. Not even close!

K1Ff06tvdh_9fa27XDgcGQ.text: GBK sums up everything good about how Kiwis do with their food. It's all about the excellent quality and making people feel like their money has been well spend, without the fiddly BS that other places often promise and rarely deliver on. The burgers are superb, I always get mine medium rare and if you dare to get that side portion of chips - you HAVE to try the garlic mayo, it's hands down the best garlic mayo you will ever try. Macs Gold is a perfect beer for those who have yet to try iNZ beer and the milkshakes are to die for.... GBK also have their online club which send very regular deals on free burgers so you hardly ever have to pay full price. As I said, generous Kiwis!

Y9ire4sZMnEc6S3MfJ0yGA.text: Forget your usual burger hang-outs - go to GBK! The burgers here are fantastic. The beef is top quality, and the range of choice is excellent; they even cater for vegetarians, and frankly, their falafal burger is one of my favourites. The service is good (although be aware that you order and pay first at the bar). I am originally from New Zealand so I personally love the range of NZ-brand beer and wine on offer, and overall the prices are pretty decent - for less than a tenner, you'll be able to completely stuff yourself. (If you want chips, I recommend sharing, because the burger will be enough on its own)!! Even if you're not a big burger fanatic, you'll really enjoy the food here. Give it a go.

WmArL1BANizUYUFt3uQwsg.text: Now, any burger joint offering a choice of bison and wild boar burgers is going to do well. The food is good (although I found the ciabatta bun on which my burger was served to be a bit soggy on the bottom), and 2 cokes, 2 of the more expensive burger, chips and a salad came in around £25. The place is relaxed, clean and tidy, and the view of the people wandering by on Westbourn Grove is entertaining. I've only been here when its quiet, and it is really deceptively big. The form is to order food and drink at the counter.

vNdQ1SzH5MzDkInDCF_8xA.text: Umm. The sum of its parts................... staff nice food nice atmosphere - nah! You have to pay up front so I did not bother going through the pain of queueing for a dessert. If it wants to be a posh Golden Arches then it has succeeded. If they want to mix it with something like Pizza Express then they need more than their USP to cut it Liked the Lemon & Paeroa though

X0bzDxbrjfFT6YU9dPSdvA.text: Gourmet Burgers are a high end Burger King - although the way BK is going you can expect to be paying £8.00 for your meal any day now. That is just like the price you'll be expecting to pay here, so maybe you can wait until Burger King increases.. or not. They're pretty good actually, with some fantastically diverse burger choices and some succinct fries to come with it. As much as I dislike American cultural based restaurants (your food is basically fatty waste, face it) this place does a decent job. Go for it.

YB6mpI3GsWexdXP9b_2TrA.text: on the expensive side, but SOOO good. the burgers here are incredible. i always get a cheeseburger and have found that the junior burger is really the way to go unless you are starvinggg. the normal burgers are incredibly tall and i find i can only make it through half of it. chips are nothing special, but their chocolate milkshakes are fantastic (though overpriced). yeah, basically i hate coming here cuz i know i'm spending way too much money but i can't help it. tastes too good! i had a coupon in december for "buy one, get one free" burger which is a steal since the burgers are NOT cheap. check out their website for potential coupons!last time i went, service was horrible! i had to get up at least four times to track down my chips, some cutlery, and some vinegar. still not enough to turn me off gbk, but the poor service & prices are enough to knock gbk from 5 to 4 stars in my book.

A3cJQBWy1agLI5zZBOg9Bg.text: ok let's face it, eating a hamburger is something that most of us love to indulge in time and again. But finding a good hamburger is another story and obviously McDonalds, Burger King & co. are not an option unless you are really desperate. GBK has executed very well on a simple idea to offer a wide range of freshly made and imaginative hamburgers in London. There are several branches and the Westbourne Grove one is the local one for me. Although the range is amazingly large (including various veggie hamburgers which are clarly pushing it a bit), I stick to cheeseburgers and hamburgers and the result is consistently good. The fries are not bad either. It is more of a take-away for me but the settings are ok. They recently opened one on Portobello Road and I am in 2 minds about that, decent food on one had but another chain outlet on the other hand

m78NayMlKf9cjH-w-F_UqA.text: After going for your first time the unforgettable and exquisite taste of their gourmet burger manages to drag you back down for another round to experience the brief yet remarkable sensation of food satisfaction. The excellent service accompanied by the great food and atmosphere really make such establishment a place worth visiting. Not to mention that their food can be ordered through food delivery apps however I would suggest ordering from deliveroo. Highly recommended

photos.caption: Photo of Gourmet Burger Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Asked for medium rare. Very nice!!

uUeaIe-XXUrgzHQYW6EuPA.text: The burgers are great!  I have been comparing all burgers to Gourmet Burgers since eating there and none have measured up.  I can't wait to visit London again so that I can have an amazing burger.  The service was also great!

t09oXGOgMWW96kr6gLxmQg.text: Just the regular GBK nothing too special about it. Our go to one because it's so close to our house. My favorite are the truffle fries :3 so delicious. Also their skinny fries are super good too. As a side note, if you are vegetarian, you can ask for any burger to be converted to veggie so you aren't limited to only the veggie section

photos.caption: Photo of Gourmet Burger Kitchen - London, United Kingdom

JfXXUAjeAzLwz1x6fcZ4cg.text: If you are staying in the Bayswater area this is a great place to have a bite to eat. First off, they have great customer service. As soon as I walked in, I was greeted which is a huge plus in my book. I ordered their Californian Veggie burger and sweet potato fried. The burger was really good and loved that it wasn't totally uniform and still contain some whole beans. The overall flavor was great and I'm a sucker for sweet potato fries. Even while I enjoyed my food, different staff came out and asked how everything was. Out of the many places I have eaten at so far in my stay in London, this place goes out of their way customer service wise. If I could give 6 stars for customer service alone, I would.

wpm5EizNL0fbxT0m2BAsTQ.text: Veggie burger tasted good but for 9 pounds , the size of the patty sure was small . They also weren't kidding when they say skinny fries .

5bE6TcOlFlr1eMQCKLdPqQ.text: Great place to grab burgers fries milkshake and beer! Great welcoming staff, lovely folks. I got the avocado burger - delicious! And they ran out of milkshakes and they offered me a fizz for free and surprised us at the table by bringing my friend one as well! Would definitely return and try out the entire menu!

bADoDEox_orsqePZ8wWB3w.text: Well that was great had the cheese and bacon burger very friendly staff food was done quickly for the take out order placed when i arrived.

photos.caption: Photo of Gourmet Burger Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Delicious

fLxny2Z5768Q8R4ATJ5ZZA.text: Wow!  The Cheese Truffle Fries are awesome!  Stopped for lunch when I was in London and had incredible service and fantastic food!  Wanted to go back before I left but didn't quite make it.

PYH-mfjYoToT16T1xMU9sw.text: As San Franciscans, we love a good burger. So when I say that my partner and I, who ordered the Camemburger and the Habanero Burger respectively, thought these some of the best burgers we'd ever had, I don't speak lightly. The habanero sauce was slightly sweet with just the right amount of burn, and the beef patties were thick and rare (as ordered).  The buns were fresh and perfectly toasted. You could see and taste the bacon in the aioli served with the sweet potato fries. We were quite happy with the entire meal.Unfortunately they were out of buffalo at the time, so we both got beef, but I can appreciate that they use fresh stock.Would give this place five stars if not for the OUTRAGEOUS cost--over £40 for two burgers, fries, and two beers. I would take somebody here to show them what a good burger tastes like...once.

WtJDxc8AiXIdsunh0t3d-A.text: The burger (the don) was to die for -- so juicy and all the flavours so well balanced. The staff is friendly, music excellent and the place is genuinely nice. The sweet potato fries with hei hei salt could be worth the visit alone. Too full for their milkshake -- but I'm going for that one next time!

aKOmTslM1xVUr9ErmYXH-A.text: Been there a couple of times ! But always a bit disappointed, so yes the burgers are huge, however as a meat lover, I like my meat blue. As they can't do less than medium, I asked for a medium, adding that I really want my meat red and juicy. And as the first time, meat was way more than medium (it was well done!) which makes that every time it didn't finish... For the price of the burger (around £7 if you pimp it a little with different sauces) I think it is too bad to go there if you really are a meat lover before a burger fan! The good sides of this chain are that the milkshakes are succulent, and the skinny fries are awesome (I think there are the only fries I have ever finished even with a burger just because they are delicious!!).

WO1V_3vdh3MsaAKKQA6yqA.text: Came here for lunch and dinner on multiple occasions, and their medium cooked burgers were different levels of amazing. The thickness of the burger patties vary from time to time and it affects how "medium" they are, but I guess that just means that they really are hand shaped and not machine made. Although their burgers were great, I can't say the same for their fries. Their skinny fries are too skinny, and their chunky fries is too deep fried, but that's just a personal preference I guess.

oLgm5-RLfsbaMhEhd31ZUg.text: Delicious skinny fries! The burgers (tried both beef and chicken) were huge and the bun was to die for!

q_TpD7693-iIpWhpNsWsFA.text: I was on the search for the best burger in London and was fairly disappointed by Gourmet Burger. The flavor a were lacking, and the fries weren't great. The milkshake was subpar. The filling sauce however was great. The servers were very nice though!

KKXElOHBYuaLWiLY05vAZQ.text: Awesome burguers and chips, nice ambient and good service, what else could you ask for a restaurant?

EeHr40X1Vnw4bLrVJjkdww.text: GBK is what it is. When in a random part of town and in need of sustenance, this will do. There's nothing wrong with it, but there's nothing particularly right either.

bGAIvH7yg9QAxcz4d3CzXQ.text: My wife and I love this place.  Best burgers in London and they have several.  Love that they have a choice of skinny fries or chips.  The burgers are cooked to your preferred temperature - big surprise in London as most are overcooked.  Also love their fizzy drinks with free refills.  Always a pleasant experience.

suJa2BFlqIUoGheReFT-8A.text: The food at GBKs is fantastic. Combined with the student discount, 5 star food and prices, no question.  The pesto burger, habanero burger, and blue cheese burgers are all fantastic and so overloaded with toppings that drip over that ordering dips for chips is superfluous. I did, however, once have a bad service experience here. GBK offers a 40% discount to students, but one must acquire a GBK student card which are available at select (but as far as I can tell unpredictable) locations in limited number.  I got sneered at for asking what locations might have student cards as this one didn't, and was told they "never get them at this location" with an unmistakable sneer and annoyance. (oddly enough, 2 weeks later, they DID have student cards here - so our sneerer was misinformed)  Since then, I"ve had some great customer service experiences, but this one sticks out enough that it is costing GBK a fifth star.

oEFV9yhVBCAXDFetUSt7iQ.text: Wow! Love this place! The buffalo burger is delicious! The sides are yummy too.Definitely among the top burger joints in london.Staff friendly and efficient.The place is spotless.As far as fast food goes, you can't get much better than this.

qcE1s8CGL3qSdUbLgBmPzg.text: Great options for vegetarians! Too bad the prices are a bit too high :(
